references.paper_title: 3d gaussian splatting for real-time radiance field rendering
references.reason: This paper introduces the 3D Gaussian Splatting (3DGS) technique, which is the foundation of the proposed method.  Understanding 3DGS is crucial for evaluating the novelty and significance of the proposed improvements for dynamic specular scenes.  The core contributions of SpectroMotion build directly upon this foundational work.

references.paper_title: sc-gs: Sparse-controlled gaussian splatting for editable dynamic scenes
references.reason: This paper extends 3DGS to dynamic scenes, which directly relates to the challenges addressed in the paper.  It represents a significant advancement in dynamic scene reconstruction, and thus provides a relevant baseline for comparing the performance of the proposed method.

references.paper_title: Forward flow for novel view synthesis of dynamic scenes
references.reason: This paper addresses the problem of dynamic scene reconstruction using forward flow for novel view synthesis.  It is directly relevant because it explores methods dealing with dynamic aspects in visual scenes, offering a valuable comparative point for the new approach presented.

references.paper_title: Gaussianshader: 3d gaussian splatting with shading functions for reflective surfaces
references.reason: This paper focuses on reflective surfaces within 3D Gaussian Splatting, which is directly relevant to the core objective of the proposed method.  Its focus on specular highlights and light interactions makes it a key reference for understanding the specific challenges being addressed.

references.paper_title: Extracting Triangular 3D Models, Materials, and Lighting From Images
references.reason: This paper discusses 3D model extraction from images.  It's relevant as the proposed method reconstructs 3D scenes, and techniques for extracting 3D models are directly applicable in this context. Understanding how materials and lighting are extracted is particularly relevant for specular rendering.

references.paper_title: Envidr: Implicit differentiable renderer with neural environment lighting
references.reason: This paper presents a neural environment lighting approach for rendering, a key aspect of handling reflections accurately.  Environment map techniques are integral to this method's ability to capture dynamic specular reflections, and this paper is a relevant point of comparison.

references.paper_title: Törf: Time-of-flight radiance fields for dynamic scene view synthesis
references.reason: This paper addresses dynamic scene reconstruction using Time-of-Flight Radiance Fields. This is relevant as it tackles the reconstruction of dynamic scenes, providing a point of comparison for novel view synthesis in scenarios involving motion.

references.paper_title: Neural reflectance fields for appearance acquisition
references.reason: This work addresses the issue of reflectance modeling, a crucial component of specular rendering.  The neural representation and acquisition of reflectance data provides direct links and similarities with the proposed method for rendering realistic specular highlights.

references.paper_title: Neural-pil: Neural pre-integrated lighting for reflectance decomposition
references.reason: This method focuses on neural pre-integrated lighting, which is related to the proposed technique using deformable environment maps.  Pre-integrated lighting methods are relevant to efficiently and effectively modeling complex lighting conditions, especially in dynamic scenes.

references.paper_title: Forward flow for novel view synthesis of dynamic scenes
references.reason: This paper is focused on novel view synthesis in dynamic scenes, directly related to the core goal of the proposed method. This approach explores methods dealing with dynamic aspects in visual scenes, offering a valuable comparative point for the new approach presented.

references.paper_title: Sc-gs: Sparse-controlled gaussian splatting for editable dynamic scenes
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant as it directly addresses the challenge of extending 3DGS to dynamic scenes. It represents a significant advancement in dynamic scene reconstruction, and provides a valuable baseline for comparing the performance of the proposed method.

references.paper_title: 3d gaussian splatting for real-time radiance field rendering
references.reason: This is the foundational paper for the 3DGS technique upon which the proposed method is built.  The paper's contributions are directly relevant to the core method used in this research.

references.paper_title: Differentiable surface splatting for point-based geometry processing
references.reason: This paper introduces a differentiable splatting technique which is fundamental to the rendering process in 3DGS. The proposed method leverages 3DGS, hence the differentiable splatting is a core component of its rendering pipeline.

references.paper_title: A reflectance model for computer graphics
references.reason: This seminal paper in computer graphics introduced the Cook-Torrance reflectance model, which is frequently used to render realistic specular reflections. The method uses a similar approach to render specular highlights.

references.paper_title: Real shading in unreal engine 4
references.reason: This paper presents real-time shading techniques in a game engine, and it is relevant to the real-time rendering aspect of the proposed method.  Real-time rendering efficiency is a crucial factor, and this paper's approach provides a useful benchmark.

references.paper_title: Nerfds: Neural radiance fields for dynamic specular objects
references.reason: This paper directly addresses the topic of dynamic specular object rendering, which is the central focus of this work.  It's a relevant comparison point for the new method and its improvements in handling dynamic specular scenes.

references.paper_title: Hypernerf: A higher-dimensional representation for topologically varying neural radiance fields
references.reason: This is a key reference as it is one of the datasets used to evaluate the proposed method.  Evaluating against a method focused on dynamic scenes provides insights into how the method's approach generalizes across different types of scenes and techniques.

references.paper_title: 4d gaussian splatting for real-time dynamic scene rendering
references.reason: This paper introduces 4D Gaussian splatting, which addresses the dynamic nature of scenes, directly relevant to this work.  It provides a baseline for comparing the performance of the proposed technique in dynamic scene reconstruction.

references.paper_title: Track anything: Segment anything meets videos
references.reason: This paper is a key reference as its output (dynamic specular masks) is used to evaluate the performance of the proposed method on the NeRF-DS dataset.  The availability of precise masks significantly impacts the assessment and evaluation.

references.paper_title: Deformable 3d gaussians for high-fidelity monocular dynamic scene reconstruction
references.reason: This paper directly addresses the challenge of dynamic scene reconstruction using deformable 3D Gaussians, which directly relates to the core technique used in the proposed method. It is a crucial comparative point to assess the improvements and novelty.
